channel.title: SciCloj Clojure Data Science community
channel.description: Blog for the Clojure Data community

item.title: Preparing to our public meeting on August 30th
item.description: A lot is happening in the Clojure data science ecosystem. While the infrastructure and tooling are gradually maturing, new libraries and experiments are rising. It seems that we are on a phase transition, and some beautiful things are about to happen.It is a good time to meet and catch up, hear about active projects and discuss future directions and ways to collaborate.
item.author: Daniel Slutsky

item.title: COVID-19 online hackathons I & II
item.description: Following yesterday's post suggesting a COVID-19 online hackathon, we got some of reactions at the mail group, the subreddit, the date poll, and mainly the relevant Zulip chat streams.Two hackathons
item.author: Teodor Heggelund and Daniel Slutsky

item.title: Planning a COVID-19 online hackathon
item.description: The scicloj community is organizing an online hackathon for studying COVID-19 data.Please mark your preferred dates for the hackathon here (yes/no/if-need-be).
item.author: Teodor Heggelund and Daniel Slutsky

item.title: Meeting Video: Guix-Jupyter with Ludovic Courtès
item.description: A lot has been happening at Scicloj in the last few weeks, but now we finally managed to edit and publish the video from a meeting we've had at January 9th.It was a special meeting, as we the topic was something out of the ususal Clojure scope: Guix-Jupyter reproducible notebooks.
item.author: Daniel Slutsky

item.title: Data Science in Clojure at Rails Girls Summer of Code
item.description: In this post I wish to write briefly about the "data science in clojure" project in Rails Girls Summer of Code 2020.Hoping to encourage people to join as students or coaches, I will try to argue why (in my opinion) it is important to the healthy growth of the clojure data science ecosystem: not only by actively addressing our goal to create a welcoming community, but also by creating a continuous process of experimentation and reflection about the usability of the emerging stack.
item.author: Daniel Slutsky

item.title: Clojure and data: wishes, problems, and ideas
item.description: On Sunday afternoon, Sep. 29th 2019, we had a meeting at the 8-bit-sheep office of Sami at Maria 01, Helsinki. One hour earlier, Konrad just finished participating in a 24h opendata hackathon. We were all tired and emotionally affected by ClojuTRE, that just ended on Friday.We ended up having a long conversation about our goals and wishes, as individuals and as parts of a community. A lot of personal stories and wild ideas were running in the room. Later Sami took us on a ride around Helsinki, which opened our tired minds even wider.
item.author: Sami Kallinen, Konrad Kühne, Daniel Slutsky

item.title: Are we scientists yet?
item.description: Previous version of this postThe Clojure community is moving a lot lately on the data science front, but we were feeling we needed some organization and more open discussion about these themes. This is the Clojureverse thread that started it all. Here we try to collect and record the current state of things, and I would like to stress the fact that this is owned by the community!
item.author: Alan Marazzi

item.title: Are we scientists yet?
item.description: The Clojure community is moving a lot lately on the data science front, but we were feeling we needed some organization and more open discussion about these themes. This is the Clojureverse thread that started it all. Here we try to collect and record the current state of things, and I would like to stress the fact that this is owned by the community!I really like how the Nim community is dealing with the same sorts of problems we're facing, so I'll try the same thing here to foster discussion. We might want to move these things in their own topic in the future or on other platforms, but that's not the point right now.
item.author: Alan Marazzi

item.title: Cryogen Quick Start Guide
item.description: This intro only documents a subset of Cryogen's features. For additional documentation please see the cryogen site.Features
